dc:title: On Pilgrimage - November 1967
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Reports from the Third World Congress for the Lay Apostolate in Rome and receives communion from the Pope. The conference "resolutions" seemed inadequate to her regarding birth control and war. Says "No one of course was really satisfied with the resolutions but most felt that they were beginnings of discussion, and that a great deal of work was necessary on the part of lay people to work and study and develop a strong conscience about the problems of the day."
